subject: Education
title: Compulsory Education: When School Became Law
description: One-minute skill: Compulsory Education: When School Became Law.

hook.text: Massachusetts passed the first compulsory education law in 1852. Parents who didn't send kids to school could be fined.

buildup.text: Before compulsory laws, child labor was normal. Factories employed children as young as five for 12-hour shifts.

discovery.text: Compulsory education was partly about ending child labor. If kids must be in school, they can't be in factories.

twist.text: Many parents resisted. Poor families needed children's wages to survive. Mandatory school meant lost income.

climax.text: By 1918, all US states required school attendance. Education shifted from privilege to legal obligation.

punchline.text: School became mandatory partly to keep children out of coal mines.

quiz.question: What was one major reason for compulsory education laws?
options: To end child labor by requiring school attendance
